		<div class="breadcrumb"><a href="/home.aspx">Home</a>&nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;<a href="/Tests.aspx" class="CMSBreadCrumbsLink">Tests</a> &gt; <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests.aspx" class="CMSBreadCrumbsLink">ASE Certification Tests</a> &gt; <span  class="CMSBreadCrumbsCurrentItem">Test Series</span>
</div><h1>Test Series</h1><div class="main-content"><h2>
 Take a look under the hood:<br />
 all the details you need on the ASE Test Series.</h2>
<p>
 There are more than 40 ASE certification tests, covering almost every imaginable aspect of the automotive repair and service industry.</p>
<p>
 If you&rsquo;re learning about ASE certification tests for the first time, we recommend that you begin with the <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests/Test-Series/General-Information.aspx">General Information</a> page, which describes the tests in general, and then click on the individual Test Series links below to learn more about the individual tests available in each Test Series.</p>
<h3>
 Registration</h3>
<p>
 To take ASE tests, you must register and pay in advance. <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests/Register-Now.aspx">Click here</a> to register for an ASE Certification Test.</p>
<h3>
 ASE Certification Test Series</h3>
<p>
 Click on the Test Series title to see details about that series.</p>
</div><div class="main-content accordion">
<h2>
  <a href="#">Auto Maintenance and Light Repair Certification Test (G1)</a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Auto Maintenance and Light Repair Certification Test (G1)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
To identify and recognize those Maintenance and Light Repair Technicians who can demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to successfully perform the most common maintenance and light repair tasks.<br />
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  Auto Maintenance and Light Repair (G1)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
The Auto Maintenance and Light Repair Certification Test (G1) contains 55 scored questions, plus 10 unscored research questions covering knowledge of the skills related to maintenance and light repairs in engine systems, automatic transmission/transaxle, manual drive train and axles, suspension and steering, brakes, electrical, and heating and air conditioning.
<h3>
 Master Status Requirements:</h3>
Does not apply to this test series.<br />
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a class="nd-g1-study-guide" href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_AutoGuide_G1_WEB.pdf" target="_blank">Maintenance and Light Repair Study Guide (pdf):</a> Includes Auto Maintenance and Light Repair&nbsp;(G1) test.&nbsp;This guide contains test specifications, task lists, and sample test questions.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. Since the G1 test in this series makes its debut in July 2013, a recertification version is not offered at this time.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Automobile & Light Truck Certification Tests (A Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Automobile &amp; Light Truck Certification Tests (A1 - A9)</h2>
<h3>
 <br />
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Automobile and Light Truck (up to 10,000 GVW) Technicians who can demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to diagnose, service, and repair cars, SUVs, and light duty trucks.</p>
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  A1 &ndash; Engine Repair (50 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  A2 &ndash; Automatic Transmission/Transaxle (50)</li>
 <li>
  A3 &ndash; Manual Drive Train &amp; Axles (40)</li>
 <li>
  A4 &ndash; Suspension &amp; Steering (40)</li>
 <li>
  A5 &ndash; Brakes (45)</li>
 <li>
  A6 &ndash; Electrical/Electronic Systems (50)</li>
 <li>
  A7 &ndash; Heating &amp; Air Conditioning (50)</li>
 <li>
  A8 &ndash; Engine Performance (50)</li>
 <li>
  A9 &ndash; Light Vehicle Diesel Engines (50)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Master Status Requirements:</h3>
<p>
 Those are certified in tests A1 &ndash; A8 are recognized as ASE-Certified Master Automobile Technicians. <em>NOTE: A9 is NOT a requirement for Master Automobile Technician Status.</em></p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Automobile &amp; Light Truck recertification tests (A1R &ndash; A8R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests.</p>
<h3>
 Service Consultants:</h3>
<p>
 Tests A1 through A9 are intended for technicians who perform vehicle repairs. ASE offers a separate C1 certification test specifically for service consultants, who work with repair technicians and car owners. <a href="#series" onclick="$('.accordion').accordion( 'option', 'active', 3);">Click here</a> for more information on the C1 test.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_AutoGuide.pdf" target="_blank">Automobile &amp; Light Truck Study Guide: Includes Tests A1 &ndash; A9, Automobile Service Consultant (C1), Alt. Fuels CNG (F1), and Exhaust Systems (X1) &ndash; (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Collision Repair & Refinish Certification Tests (B Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Collision Repair &amp; Refinish Certification Tests (B2 &ndash; B5)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
To identify and recognize those Collision Repair Technicians and Refinishers who possess knowledge of the skills necessary to properly analyze and repair automotive collision damage and correct paint finish damage.
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  B2 &ndash; Painting &amp; Refinishing (55 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  B3 &ndash; Non-Structural Analysis &amp; Damage Repair (55)</li>
 <li>
  B4 &ndash; Structural Analysis &amp; Damage Repair (50)</li>
 <li>
  B5 &ndash; Mechanical &amp; Electrical Components (50)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Master Status Requirements:</h3>
<p>
 Those who are certified in tests B2 &ndash; B5 are recognized as ASE-Certified Master Collision Repair Technicians.&nbsp;<em>NOTE: B6 is NOT a requirement for Master Collision Repair Technician Status.</em></p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Collision Repair and Refinish recertification tests (B2R &ndash; B5R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests.</p>
<h3>
 Collision Damage Estimators:</h3>
<p>
 Tests B2 through B5 are intended for technicians who perform repairs in collision repair shops. ASE offers a separate B6 certification test specifically for estimators, whether they work in a shop, write estimates for insurance companies, or are independent adjustors. <a href="#series" onclick="$('.accordion').accordion( 'option', 'active', 2);">Click here</a> for more information on the B6 test.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_Collision.pdf" target="_blank">Collision Repair &amp; Refinish Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Damage Analysis & Estimating Certification Test (B6) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Damage Analysis &amp; Estimating Certification Test (B6)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Estimators who possess knowledge of the skills necessary to properly analyze and estimate automotive collision damage.</p>
<p>
 This test complements those in the Collision Repair Test Series (Tests B2 &ndash; B5), and is specially intended for professionals who may not actually repair vehicles, but have the special knowledge needed to assess collision damage, estimate repair costs, and work with vehicle owners.</p>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
<p>
 The Damage Analysis and Estimating (B6) test contains 50 scored questions on damage analysis, estimating, legal and environmental practices, vehicle construction, vehicle systems, parts identification and source, and customer relations and sales.</p>
<h3>
 Work Experience Requirement:</h3>
<p>
 To become ASE certified, Estimators must pass the B6 test and present proof of two years of work experience specifically related to damage analysis and estimating, not hands-on collision repair.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Estimators must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Damage Analysis and Estimating recertification test (B6R) is about half as long as the initial certification test.</p>
<h3>
 Collision Repair &amp; Refinish Technicians:</h3>
<p>
 The B6 certification test is intended for those who write estimates for collision damage repair. ASE offers a separate series of tests B2 through B5 that are intended specifically for technicians who perform repairs in collision repair shops. <a href="#series" onclick="$('.accordion').accordion( 'option', 'active', 1);">Click here</a> for more information on these tests.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_Collision_2012_WEB.pdf" target="_blank">Collision Repair &amp; Refinish Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Automobile Service Consultant Certification Test (C1) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Automobile Service Consultant Certification Test (C1)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To improve the quality of vehicle service through the voluntary testing and certification of Service Consultant professionals.</p>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
<p>
 The Automobile Service Consultant (C1) test contains 50 scored questions on communications, customer and internal relations, vehicle systems knowledge, sales skills, and shop operations.</p>
<h3>
 Work Experience Requirement:</h3>
<p>
 To become ASE certified, Service Consultants must pass the C1 test and present proof of two years of work experience specifically related to service writing, not hands-on automotive repair.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Service Consultants must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Service Consultant recertification test (C1R) is about half as long as the initial certification test.</p>
<h3>
 Automobile Technicians:</h3>
<p>
 The C1 certification test is intended for those who work as service consultants. ASE offers a separate series of tests A1 through A9 that are intended specifically for technicians who perform automobile and light truck repairs. <a href="#series" onclick="$('.accordion').accordion( 'option', 'active', 0);">Click here</a> for more information on these tests.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_AutoGuide.pdf" target="_blank">Automobile &amp; Light Truck Study Guide: Includes Tests A1 &ndash; A9, Automobile Service Consultant (C1), Alt. Fuels CNG (F1), and Exhaust Systems (X1) (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Truck Equipment Certification Tests (E Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Truck Equipment Certification Tests (E1 &ndash; E3)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Truck Equipment Technicians who can demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to install, diagnose, service, and repair truck equipment and related support systems on all classes of trucks and tractors.</p>
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  E1 &ndash; Truck Equipment Installation &amp; Repair (45 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  E2 &ndash; Electrical/Electronic Systems Installation &amp; Repair (50)</li>
 <li>
  E3 &ndash; Auxiliary Power Systems Installation &amp; Repair (50)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Master Certification Requirements:</h3>
<p>
 Those who are certified in tests E1 &ndash; E3 are recognized as ASE-Certified Master Truck Equipment Technicians.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Truck Equipment recertification tests (E1R &ndash; E3R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_TruckEquip.pdf" target="_blank">Truck Equipment Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Alternate Fuels Certification Test (F1) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Alternate Fuels Certification Test (F1)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Technicians who can demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to diagnose, service, and repair compressed natural gas vehicles.</p>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
<p>
 The Compressed Natural Gas Vehicle (F1) test contains 55 scored questions on vehicle inspection, equipment installation, leak testing and repairs, emissions, system diagnosis, maintenance and repair, and cylinder safety.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Alternate Fuels CNG Vehicle recertification test (F1R) is about half as long as the initial certification test.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_AutoGuide.pdf" target="_blank">Automobile &amp; Light Truck Study Guide: Includes Tests A1 &ndash; A9, Automobile Service Consultant (C1), Alt. Fuels CNG (F1), and Exhaust Systems (X1) (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Transit Bus Certification Tests (H Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Transit Bus Certification Tests (H1 &ndash; H8)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Transit Bus Technicians who demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to diagnose, service, and repair various systems on transit buses.</p>
<p>
 ASE initiated this Test Series with the support of the U.S. Department of Transportation and the American Public Transportation Association (APTA). While several of these tests parallel the ASE Medium-Heavy Truck and School Bus tests, each is designed to test knowledge of systems specific to transit buses.</p>
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  H1 &ndash; Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) Engines (50 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  H2 &ndash; Diesel Engines (50)</li>
 <li>
  H3 &ndash; Drive Train (40)</li>
 <li>
  H4 &ndash; Brakes (50)</li>
 <li>
  H5 &ndash; Suspension &amp; Steering (45)</li>
 <li>
  H6 &ndash; Electrical/Electronic Systems (50)</li>
 <li>
  H7 &ndash; Heating Ventilation &amp; Air Conditioning (HVAC) (50)</li>
 <li>
  H8 &ndash; Preventive Maintenance &amp; Inspection (PMI) (50)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Master Certification Requirements:</h3>
<p>
 Those who are certified in tests H1 or H2, plus H3 &ndash; H8, are recognized as ASE-Certified Master Transit Bus Technicians.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Transit Bus recertification tests (H2R, H4R, H6R, and H7R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests. Other Transit Bus recertification tests will be added over time.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_TransitBus.pdf" target="_blank&amp;quot;">Transit Bus Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Advanced Engine Performance Specialist Certification Test (L1)</a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Advanced Engine Performance Specialist Certification Test (L1)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify those Technicians who possess knowledge of the skills required to diagnose sophisticated driveability and emissions-related problems on automobiles, SUVs, and light-duty trucks.</p>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
<p>
 The Advanced Engine Performance Specialist (L1) test contains 50 scored questions focused on the diagnosis of general power-train, computerized power-train controls (including OBD II), ignition systems, fuel and air induction systems, emission control systems, and I/M test failures. Because of the complexity of the L1 test, ASE generally recommends that you NOT register for other tests during the same test session.</p>
<h3>
 Composite Vehicle:</h3>
<p>
 Many of the questions relate to a sample vehicle using a composite power-train control system featuring computerized engine control technology used by most manufacturers. This vehicle is described in the Composite Vehicle Type 3 Reference Booklet that is provided both before and at the time of testing. Use the link below to download and review this booklet prior to taking the L1 test.</p>
<h3>
 Prerequisite:</h3>
<p>
 To register for&nbsp;the regular L1 certification test, you must be currently certified in Automobile Engine Performance (A8) and satisfy the two-year, hands-on work experience requirement. To register for the&nbsp;recertification version of the Advanced Engine Performance Specialist&nbsp;Test (L1R), all that&#39;s required is a&nbsp;previous L1 certification.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Advanced Engine Performance Specialist recertification test (L1R) is the same length as the regular certification test.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guides:</h3>
<p>
 <a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_2010_L1_Test_Information.pdf" target="_blank">Advanced Engine Performance Specialist Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.</p>
<p>
 <a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/(Web-Resolution)-ASE_2010_L1_Composite_Vehicle_20110817.pdf" target="_blank">Composite Vehicle Type 3 Reference Booklet (PDF)</a> - this booklet describes the composite drivetrain control system that is used with many of the questions in the L1 test.</p>

</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Electronic Diesel Engine Diagnosis Specialist Certification Test (L2)</a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Electronic Diesel Engine Diagnosis Specialist Certification Test (L2)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify those Technicians who possess knowledge of the skills necessary to diagnose sophisticated diesel engine performance problems on medium- and heavy-duty trucks.</p>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
<p>
 The Electronic Diesel Engine Diagnosis Specialist (L2) test contains 45 questions focused on the diagnosis of general diesel engine, electronic diesel engine controls, diesel engine air induction and exhaust systems, diesel fuel systems, and specific fuel systems, including electronic unit injector (EUI), pump-line-nozzle electronic (PLN-E) and hydraulic electronic unit injector (HEUI) systems. Because of the complexity of the L2 test, ASE generally recommends that you NOT register for other tests during the same test session.</p>
<h3>
 Composite Vehicle:</h3>
<p>
 Many of the questions relate to a sample vehicle equipped with a composite diesel engine control system featuring a cross-section of electronic diesel engine control technology used by all engine manufacturers. This vehicle is described in the Medium-Heavy Composite Vehicle Type 2 Reference Booklet that is provided both before and at the time of testing. Use the link below to download and review this booklet prior to taking the L2 test.</p>
<h3>
 Prerequisite:</h3>
<p>
 To register for the regular L2 certification test, you must be currently certified in one of the ASE Diesel Engine tests (A9, H2, S2, or T2) and one of the ASE Electrical/Electronic Systems tests (A6, H6, S6 or T6), and satisfy the two-year, hands-on work experience requirement. To register for the&nbsp;recertification version of the Electronic Diesel Engines Diagnosis Specialist Test (L2R), all that&#39;s required is a previous&nbsp;L2 certification.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Advanced Diesel Engine Diagnosis Specialist recertification test (L2R) is the same length as the regular&nbsp;certification test.</p>
<p>
 <strong>Download the Study Guides:</strong></p>
<p>
 <a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_2010_L2_Test_Information.pdf" target="_blank">Advanced Diesel Engine Diagnosis Specialist Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.</p>
<p>
 <a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/(Web-Resolution)-ASE_2010_L2_Composite_Vehicle_20110817-WEB-RES.pdf" target="_blank">Medium-Heavy Composite Vehicle Type&nbsp;3 Reference Booklet (PDF)</a> - this booklet describes the composite electronic diesel engine control system that is used with many of the questions in the L2 test.</p>

</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Engine Machinist Certification Tests (M Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>Engine Machinist Certification Tests (M1 &ndash; M3)</h2>
<h3>Discontinued Tests:</h3>
<p>Effective December 31, 2010, ASE will no longer offer the Truck Aftermarket Brake Parts (P3), Truck Aftermarket Suspension &amp; Steering (P9), or the Engine Machinist (M1, M2, and M3) tests as part of its certification program. The last opportunity to take a certification or recertification P3, P9, or Engine Machinist test was the Fall 2010 testing administration.</p>
<p>The ASE Board Of Directors carefully examined trends in the industry, as well as the numbers of test-takers required to provide enough data to ensure a quality testing product beyond 2010. Based on results of the study, the Board decided to discontinue these tests. No other ASE certification tests are affected.</p>
<p>ASE will provide information and support, through 2015, to all who are certified in Machinist and P3/P9 areas.</p>
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Parts Specialist Certification Tests (P Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Parts Specialist Certification Tests (P1, P2, and P4)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To improve the quality of service offered by Automobile and Medium-Heavy Truck Parts Specialists through the voluntary testing and certification of parts professionals.</p>
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  P1 &ndash; Medium-Heavy Truck Dealership Parts Specialist (70 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  P2 &ndash; Automobile Parts Specialist (75)</li>
 <li>
  P4 &ndash; General Motors Parts Consultant (65)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Discontinued Tests:</h3>
<p>
 Effective December 31, 2010, ASE will no longer offer the Truck Aftermarket Brake Parts (P3), Truck Aftermarket Suspension &amp; Steering (P9), or the Engine Machinist (M1, M2, and M3) tests as part of its certification program. The last opportunity to take a certification or recertification P3, P9, or Engine Machinist test was the Fall 2010 testing administration.</p>
<p>
 The ASE Board Of Directors carefully examined trends in the industry, as well as the numbers of test-takers required to provide enough data to ensure a quality testing product beyond 2010. Based on results of the study, the Board decided to discontinue these tests. No other ASE certification tests are affected.</p>
<p>
 ASE will provide information and support, through 2015, to all who are certified in Machinist and P3/P9 areas.</p>
<h3>
 Work Experience Requirement:</h3>
<p>
 To become ASE certified, Parts Specialists must pass one or more of the Parts series tests and present proof of two years of work experience specifically related to parts counter work, not hands-on automotive repair.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Parts Specialists must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Parts Specialist recertification tests (P1R, P2R, and P4R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_PartSpc.pdf" target="_blank">Parts Specialist Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">School Bus Certification Tests (S Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 School Bus Certification Tests (S1 &ndash; S7)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those School Bus Technicians who possess the knowledge and skills necessary to diagnose, service, and repair different subsystems of Type A, B, C, and D school buses.</p>
<p>
 ASE initiated this Test Series at the request of the National Association for Pupil Transportation (NAPT). While several of these tests parallel the ASE Medium-Heavy Truck and Transit Bus tests, each is designed to test knowledge of systems specific to school buses.</p>
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  S1 &ndash; Body Systems &amp; Special Equipment (50 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  S2 &ndash; Diesel Engines (55)</li>
 <li>
  S3 &ndash; Drive Train (45)</li>
 <li>
  S4 &ndash; Brakes (50)</li>
 <li>
  S5 &ndash; Suspension &amp; Steering (50)</li>
 <li>
  S6 &ndash; Electrical/Electronic Systems (45)</li>
 <li>
  S7 &ndash; Air Conditioning Systems &amp; Controls (45)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Master Certification Requirements:</h3>
<p>
 Those who are certified in tests S1 &ndash; S6 are recognized as ASE-Certified Master School Bus Technicians. <em>NOTE: S7 is NOT a requirement for Master School Bus Technician Status.</em></p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The School Bus recertification tests (S1R &ndash; S7R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_SchoolBus.pdf" target="_blank">School Bus Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Medium-Heavy Truck Certification Tests (T Series) </a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Medium-Heavy Truck Certification Tests (T1 &ndash; T8)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Medium and Heavy Truck Technicians who can demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to diagnose, service, and repair different systems of Class 4 through Class 8 trucks and tractors.</p>
<h3>
 Tests Offered:</h3>
<ul>
 <li>
  T1 &ndash; Gasoline Engines (50 scored questions)</li>
 <li>
  T2 &ndash; Diesel Engines (55)</li>
 <li>
  T3 &ndash; Drive Train (40)</li>
 <li>
  T4 &ndash; Brakes (50)</li>
 <li>
  T5 &ndash; Suspension &amp; Steering (50)</li>
 <li>
  T6 &ndash; Electrical/ Electronic Systems (50)</li>
 <li>
  T7 &ndash; Heating, Ventilation &amp; Air Conditioning (HVAC) (40)</li>
 <li>
  T8 &ndash; Preventive Maintenance Inspection (50)</li>
</ul>
<h3>
 Master Certification Requirements:</h3>
<p>
 Those who are certified in tests T2 &ndash; T7 are recognized as ASE-Certified Master Medium-Heavy Truck Technicians. <em>NOTE: Neither T1 nor T8 are required for Master Medium-Heavy Truck Technician Status.</em></p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Technicians must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Medium-Heavy Truck recertification tests (T1R &ndash; T8R) are about half as long as the initial certification tests.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_MedHeavyTruck.pdf" target="_blank">Medium-Heavy Truck Study Guide (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div><h2>
  <a href="#">Undercar Specialist Exhaust Systems Test (X1)</a>
</h2>
<div>
  <h2>
 Undercar Specialist Exhaust Systems Test (X1)</h2>
<h3>
 Objective:</h3>
<p>
 To identify and recognize those Technicians who can demonstrate knowledge of the skills necessary to diagnose and repair automobile brakes, suspension and steering, and exhaust systems.</p>
<p>
 The ASE Undercar Specialist designation recognizes Technicians who have demonstrated knowledge of the skills in Suspension &amp; Steering (A4) and Brakes (A5) from the Automobile &amp; Light Truck Test Series, and Exhaust Systems (X1) from the Specialty Test Series. Although it is not a stand-alone certification, Exhaust Systems (X1) has been combined as a technical complement to test technicians&rsquo; knowledge of exhaust systems. To earn the Undercar Specialist designation, you must be concurrently certified in all three tests: A4, A5, and X1.</p>
<h3>
 Test Content:</h3>
<p>
 The Exhaust Systems (X1) test contains 40 scored questions on exhaust system inspection and repair, fabrication, installation, emissions systems diagnosis and repair, and exhaust system repair regulations.</p>
<h3>
 Prerequisite:</h3>
<p>
 You must be currently certified in both Automobile Suspension and Steering (A4) and Automobile Brakes (A5), and satisfy the two-year hands-on work experience requirement in order to register for the X1 test.</p>
<h3>
 Recertification:</h3>
<p>
 Undercar Specialists must retest every five years to retain their certification. The Exhaust Systems recertification test (X1R) is about half as long as the initial certification test. Note that you must also be currently certified in both Automobile Suspension and Steering (A4) and Automobile Brakes (A5), and satisfy the two-year hands-on work experience requirement in order to register for the X1R test.</p>
<h3>
 Download the Study Guide:</h3>
<a href="/MediaLibrary/Images/PDF%20folder/ASE_AutoGuide.pdf" target="_blank">Automobile &amp; Light Truck Study Guide: Includes Tests A1 &ndash; A9, Automobile Service Consultant (C1), Alt. Fuels CNG (F1), and Exhaust Systems (X1) &ndash; (PDF)</a> - this guide contains test specifications, tasks lists, sample test questions, and training resources.
</div>
</div><div>
 <h3>
  <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests/Test-Series/Master-Status.aspx">Master Status</a></h3>
 <p>
  Technicians who pass multiple tests can earn ASE Master Status in one or more test series. Get the details <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests/Test-Series/Master-Status.aspx">here</a>.</p>
 <h3>
  <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests/Test-Series/Who-writes-the-ASE-test-questions-.aspx">Who Writes the Test Questions?</a></h3>
 <p>
  Do the ASE certification tests have trick questions or more than one right answer? Find out the <a href="/Tests/ASE-Certification-Tests/Test-Series/Who-writes-the-ASE-test-questions-.aspx">truth</a>.</p>
</div>

<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        var mcid = getUrlVars()["mcid"];

        if (!mcid)
            return;

        $('a').each(function () {
            var href = $(this).attr('href');

            if (href) {
                href = href.toLowerCase();
                if (href.indexOf('mcid=') === -1 &&
                    href.indexOf('javascript:') === -1 &&
                    href.indexOf('#') === -1) {
                    href += (href.match(/\?/) ? '&' : '?') + 'mcid=' + mcid;
                    $(this).attr('href', href);
                }
            }
        });
    });

    function getUrlVars() {
        var vars = [], hash;
        var hashes = window.location.href.slice(window.location.href.indexOf('?') + 1).split('&');
        for (var i = 0; i < hashes.length; i++) {
            hash = hashes[i].split('=');
            vars.push(hash[0]);
            vars[hash[0]] = hash[1];
        }
        return vars;
    }
</script>
